name: Senator Bob Casey
tweet_text: People who became disabled prior to their 26th birthday have access to ABLE. For millions of others who acquire their disabilities later in life? They're shut out from the program. That must be changed.

name: Senator Bob Casey
tweet_text: We created ABLE to knock down the savings barriers people with disabilities face. Since 2014, 46 states and D.C. have used the ABLE Act to create special savings accounts for disabled residents. It's helped thousands of Americans, but there are limitations to who can access ABLE.

tweet_text: Americans with disabilities are disproportionately impacted by poverty largely because federal programs limit the amount they can save. That directly affects their ability to save for homes, assistive technology, retirement and more.
